ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: -Knowledge re: the history of medieval sculpture, its iconographical meaning, techniques of medieval sculpture and polychromy, its effect on the medieval viewer
I have a much better understanding of the issues that are currently being explored in the field of Gothic sculpture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The museum trips were very interesting and made the subject matter come alive. I think the students were dedicated to providing engaging and informative presentations, which was wonderful; however, the frequency of these class presentations could have been announced at the beginning of the course.

I found the thematic arrangement of the course very engaging. I also really enjoyed the field trips. I think they have been very helpful in understanding the different issues and approaches on a practical level. My main suggestion would be to perhaps consider spreading the presentations more (maybe alternate the weeks/people), so the students have more time to prepare for them and there is more room for discussion. It also would have been helpful to have a plan for these in advance.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you are prepared for the workload.
I would recommend this course to any student interested in improving their knowledge and understanding of both the sculpture and the current issues in the field.
